p: The CCR5Δ32 is a highly penetrating polymorphism, and exerts a robust phenotypic effect on CCR5. However, the expression of CCR5 is regulated by other polymorphisms in addition to CCR5Δ32 ( Mehlotra, 2019). Also, the CCR5 expression is influenced by non-coding genetic elements. The effect of the genetic backround of the host can also be exacerbated or diminished depending on the environmental conditions to which the individual is exposed ( Ellwanger et al., 2018c; Kulkarni et al., 2019). Taking together, these factors help to explain why many of the effects exerted by CCR5 on a given disease are specific to a certain population, ethnic group, or individual.
